author: José Rodríguez Cámara
title: Un centenar de personas reza el rosario en desagravio por la profanación a la Virgen del Carmen en Rincón
text:
Secciones
Servicios
Destacamos
José Rodríguez Cámara
Rincón de la Victoria
Viernes, 31 de mayo 2024, 22:14
Necesitas ser suscriptor para acceder a esta funcionalidad.
Compartir
Un centenar de personas se ha reunido en la 'Piedra Ancha' de El Cantal, donde se ubica la hornaciona de Nuestra Señora del Carmen en Rincón de la Victoria. Allín han rezado en desagravio por la profanación a la hornacina de la venerada imagen, ocurrida hace una semana, tal y como ha recordado el hermano mayor, Paco de la Torre, al que ha acompañado el párroco, Leandro Carrasco.
La cofradía había hecho un llamamiento a los fieles y, en general, a la ciudadanía, para participar en un rosario frente al pequeño templete en el que, debido a que la talla ha sufrido importantes destrozos, se ha colocado una fotografía de la patrona de los marineros, en tanto no se restaura la imagen. De la Torre ha agradecido la presencia de miembros de la Corporación Municipal, así como de representantes de otras hermandades del municipio o el grupo Emáus, que se ha desplazado desde Málaga. «Una vez pasado el impacto del primer momento por lo ocurrido, estamos tranquilos, preparados para afrontar la solución», ha destacado el representante del colectivo religioso que, eso sí, ha recordado el «daño moral y al patrimonio» sufrido.
Noticia relacionada
José Rodríguez Cámara
La Hermandad de Nuestra Señora del Carmen informó de los graves actos incívicos en el pequeño templete, en el que se exhibe la imagen de la Virgen, el pasado sábado por la mañana. Los hechos, rápidamente, se pusieron en conocimiento de la Guardia Civil, para que abriera una investigación. Uno de los primeros en acudir al lugar fue el alcalde, Francisco Salado. El regidor mostró su solidaridad con todos los cofrades, ante lo que consideró como «un ataque salvaje y contra la libertad religiosa», así como contra el patrimonio local, además, expresó su indignación porque se trata del cuarto acto vandálico contra la hornacina, en un contexto, lamentó, de destrozos en otros puntos del municipio, como son la Huerta San Julián o el Parque Baluma.

author: HT Sports Desk
title: 'Not a baby': Shastri knocks down Shardul, sends 'Ranji Trophy' SOS to Arshdeep | Cricket - Hindustan Times
text: 'He is not a baby': Shastri knocks down Shardul Thakur amid abysmal bowling, sends 'Ranji Trophy' SOS to Arshdeep Singh Ravi Shastri feels Shardul Thakur is not the perfect 4th seamer for India in Tests and requested Arshdeep Singh to play for Ranji cricket to be ready for Tests. Former India coach [Ravi Shastri](https://www.hindustantimes.com/topic/ravi-shastri) has scrutinised [Shardul Thakur](https://www.hindustantimes.com/cricket/players/shardul-thakur-63345) for his lacklustre bowling in India's innings defeat to South Africa at the Centurion Test. Shardul, the fourth Indian pace-bowling option had a forgettable game, finishing with 1/101 at an economy rate of 5.3, making him the most expensive Indian bowler among all five. Clearly, the Indian think tank's decision to add him to bolster the batting didn't pay off either with Shardul's scores of 24 and 2. While India’s batting capitulation is what made most headlines - leading to an [innings defeat](https://www.hindustantimes.com/cricket/indias-final-frontier-dreams-up-in-smoke-in-three-days-against-a-10-man-south-africa-101703776166464.html) - that their bowling appeared toothless and without bite paints a sorry picture. Since Johannesburg 2022, where he took 7/61, Shardul has taken just 7 wickets in 7 Tests, his downward curve evident. Shastri felt what India lacked was experience, which despite Shardul's experience wasn't enough - despite dismissing Dean Elgar, he was average overall. Prasidh Krishna was making his Test debut and with Mohammed Shami out injured, the bowling was always going to be a worry for the Indians. [Click here](https://www.hindustantimes.com/2024-planner-guide-and-2023-top-events-recap) "India lacked experience in their bowling attack. They’ve got two of them who are reasonable experienced - Bumrah and Siraj - but they missed Shami big time. Shardul Thakur is not a baby, but he is the 4th seamer. You need a proper third seamer and that makes a massive difference overseas," Shastri said after South Africa's innings ended on 408/9 with a lead of 163 runs. Go play Ranji Trophy, Shastri tells Arshdeep So what are the options? Mukesh Kumar is still new and India have long moved on from Ishant Sharma and Umesh Yadav – the once formidable force as part of the Indian pack of five. Mark Nicholas, who was discussion India's abject bowling along with Shastri mentioned a very interesting name – [Arshdeep Singh](https://www.hindustantimes.com/cricket/players/arshdeep-singh-67905) – but before everyone could get carried away, the ex-coach raised a very valid point. Sure enough, Arshdeep set the South Africa ODIs with a five-wicket-haul in Johannesburg, followed by 4/30 in Paarl, and brings a left-arm variety too, but is he ready for the gruelling format of Test cricket? Shastri doesn't think so just yet but made a plea to Arshdeep, which the youngster could do following. "The thing is you want to see his First-Class record. Can he bowl long spells? Has he played a lot of Ranji Trophy cricket? I would in fact go and make him play a lot of it, Ranji and First-Class cricket and keep him in the mix because if someone can swing it like he did with the white ball in South Africa, he could be a handy customer," Shastri added on. [Login Now!](https://accounts.hindustantimes.com/?type=plain&ref=ht&funnel_entry=end_of_article&cta=end_of_article&is_premium=false/) Catch all the Latest [Cricket News](https://www.hindustantimes.com/cricket), [Live Cricket Score](https://www.hindustantimes.com/cricket/live-score)and [India vs South Africa](https://www.hindustantimes.com/cricket/team-ind-vs-sa-live-score-india-south-africa-upcoming-matches-and-results-4-7)match updates along with [Cricket Schedule](https://www.hindustantimes.com/cricket/schedule)and [India vs South Africa Live Score](https://www.hindustantimes.com/cricket/india-vs-south-africa-live-score-1st-test-match-today-28-december-ind-vs-sa-in-supersport-park-cricket-stadium-centurion-101703736948496.html)other related updates on Hindustan Times Website and APPs

author: Syndicated Content
title: Nicaragua arrests two high-ranking Catholic priests with close ties to cardinal
text:
By Ismael Lopez
SAN JOSE (Reuters) – Nicaraguan police detained on Thursday two senior Catholic priests who are close to the country’s top church leader, a person with knowledge of the matter said, raising to at least six the number of clergymen detained this week.
The source, who declined to be named for fear of arrest, said the two priests were detained for publicly praying for jailed Bishop Rolando Alvarez, the most prominent critic of President Daniel Ortega.
Local media outlet Confidencial named the priests as Carlos Aviles and Hector Treminio, and noted that their arrest brings to at least six the number of priests detained over the past week, adding that two of the clerics had already been released.
The government’s press office did not immediately respond to a request for comment.
Over the past few years, Ortega’s government has targeted members of the Catholic church, a crackdown officials have in the past said was needed to punish treasonous behavior or other alleged crimes.
Aviles is the second-highest ranking cleric in the Archdiocese of Managua, led by Cardinal Leopoldo Brenes, while Treminio is its treasurer.
Alvarez, the bishop of Matagalpa, forcefully criticized the government’s deadly response to mass protests that broke out in 2018, and was convicted of treason and sentenced to a 26-year prison term earlier this year.
Last week, police arrested Bishop Isidro Mora of the Siuna diocese, making him the second bishop to be detained after Alvarez’s detention in 2022.
Many of the latest clergymen detained were arrested because they publicly offered prayers for Alvarez, according to the source and local media, but the government has not issued any statements explaining the priests’ alleged crimes.
Nicaraguan Bishop Silvio Baez, who has been living in exile in Florida since 2019 and is the second-ranking leader of the archdiocese, called for the priests to be released.
“I ask God to protect them and that they be freed immediately!” wrote in a post on X on Thursday.
According to exiled Nicaraguan researcher Martha Patricia Molina, who publishes records of what she describes as the persecution of the Catholic Church under Ortega, the number of bishops, priests and seminarians behind bars in the country currently stands at nine.
(Reporting by Ismael Lopez; Writing by David Alire Garcia and Miral Fahmy)

author: fijivillage
title: China reaffirms commitment to supporting Fiji in climate change response
text:
As Fiji continues to face challenges from the impacts of climate change, the Peoples Republic of China stated today that it will remain committed to assisting Fiji in this matter.
While speaking at the press briefing and promoting exchanges on China-Fiji relations, the Chinese Ambassador to Fiji, Zhou Jian, said their commitment to climate change will never change, and their support to Pacific Island countries in climate change response will remain unchanged, and they will double their efforts.
Jian says they will join hands with the Pacific Island countries in their endeavour to climate change response.
The Ambassador says China is a stabiliser country in the changing world.
Jian says their aim is for global security to hold high the banner of peace.
He says they also focus on meeting the common demand, especially in the developing countries.
He adds in recent years, China has engaged in extensive cooperation with Pacific Island countries under the framework of the Belgium initiative, achieving fruitful results.
Jian adds China continue to promote integrated development of technological innovation and industrial innovation empowering the world with technology.
Stay tuned for the latest news on our radio stations

author: BBC News
title: GP leaders vote to ballot staff on strike action
text:
Scottish GP leaders have voted in favour of a motion to ballot workers on taking industrial action over pay, blaming "years of disinvestment in general practice".
At the conference for BMA Scotland's Local Medical Committee (LMC) in Clydebank, representatives said it was important to "make the Scottish government see the harm they have caused and redress the balance of healthcare provision."
The LMC represent GPs in regions throughout Scotland and said GPs were not given fair pay awards compared to other doctors in the NHS.
The Scottish Health Secretary Neil Gray said that extra funding would help practices retain staff.
The LMC argued that staff have faced funding cuts instead of uplifts.
A spokesperson for Grampian LMC, who put the motion forward, said the call for a ballot on industrial action was supported unanimously.
The spokesperson said: "Industrial action is not an easy step for independent contractor GPs to take.
"We know the patients we care for well, and we know what a restriction in services would mean to them.
"However, this needs to be balanced with the significantly higher risk of a longer-term reduction in service due to 15 years of chronic underfunding of general practice, and the risk of harm to patients that will result from this."
Cost of temporary psychiatrists soars as doctor numbers fall NHS consultants in Scotland accept 10.5% pay rise Last month the Scottish government announced a total increase to general medical services of 7.5% with an intended uplift of 6% for GP pay.
The government later announced an overall 11% pay uplift to NHS consultants.
Dr Iain Morrison, who chairs the BMA's Scottish GP committee, said: "As much as we are pleased for our friends and colleagues who are deserving of steps towards pay restoration, it simply adds to the evidence that the Scottish government values other doctors more than ourselves."
The committee unveiled the results of a pay survey completed by more than 1,100 GPs across Scotland, where 86% said this year's pay award was not enough.
And nearly two thirds say they are more likely to leave the NHS as a result.
Dr Morrison said: "Worryingly, 65% are prepared to cause significant service disruption through industrial action.
"For this to come from one of the most altruistic vocations, shows that government must work with us at pace to recover the dire situation.
"Otherwise, we will be left with no other choice than to move in this direction, as a last resort to save general practice as we know it."
'Imbalance in funding' Dr Morrison urged the government to increase funding from 6.5% of the NHS budget to 15% to allow for the recruitment of 1,800 whole-time equivalent GPs.
He added: "We will strive to work with all stakeholders in addressing the imbalance in funding for the health service that has plagued our profession since 2004.
"Since this time we have seen general practice’s share of the NHS budget persistently eroded from 11% in 2004 to 6.5% now.
"This has directly led to the number of whole time equivalent GPs across Scotland flatlining and now receding. At the same time consultant posts have risen significantly.
"The warm words from this government about their recognition of general practice and the need to shift resource and care delivery into our communities had its lack of sincerity brutally exposed with this year’s pay awards."
At the conference, the health secretary committed to allocating an additional £13.6m for general practice this financial year to support staff costs.
He said: "GPs are essential to the delivery of high quality, sustainable general practice services, and that is why I today announced an additional £13.6 million of funding in this financial year to help practices recruit and retain key staff.
“Scotland has a higher number of GPs per head than the rest of the UK, and a record 1,200 plus trainee GPs coming through the training system. We are determined to increase the number of GPs in Scotland by 800, by 2027."
He also pointed to an expansion of the "primary care multi-disciplinary team workforce" and increased funding to General Medical Services.
Getty Images The move affects GPs across Scotland Earlier Gray told conference attendees he took their feedback "seriously" and would continue to advocate for GPs.
He said: "This additional funding will help GPs to underpin business decisions and provide high-quality patient care.
"Sustainable reform of the NHS means we must look to shift more care to primary and community care with a relentless focus on better outcomes for people."
Dr Morrison welcomed the funding announcement as "a step in the right direction in terms of redressing the loss of funding directly delivered to GPs in recent years."
However he said there was "still considerable distance to travel to deliver the more equitable funding settlement for general practice that is clearly required to put the profession on a sustainable footing."
GPs say National Insurance rise could close Highland practices GPs demand protection from Budget tax hike

author: js.chinanews.com
title: 解锁江苏城市"青春密码"--中国新闻网|江苏
text:
解锁江苏城市“青春密码”
哪座城市“含青量”最高，哪些城市毕业生留存率领先，产业如何托举青年创业？
解锁江苏城市“青春密码”
年轻人是城市生生不息的动力，城市更高的“青春浓度”，代表着更强的活力、潜力和更持久的竞争力。近日，江苏省青年发展研究中心等推出《激活城市年轻力——江苏青年发展型城市研究报告》，多维解锁江苏城市的“青春密码”：南京是全省“含青量”最高的城市，14—35周岁青年常住人口占比达30.69%；宿迁是全省“最年轻城市”，常住人口平均年龄37.43岁；而苏州以27.9%的青年参与投资经营主体数量占比领跑全省……
城市何以青春？青年人有多样选择的当下，薪资固然重要，但不再是全部。近年来，江苏各地纵深推进青年发展型城市建设，围绕宜业、宜居、宜游等场景激活城市对青年人的吸引力。更青春的江苏，让青年在城市放手打拼、勇敢追梦，与城市同成长、共出彩。
就业磁场：这是与城市产业脉搏同频共振
初夏的苏州吴江区，吴姝芃穿过行色匆匆的人群，突然想起去年夏天拖着行李箱赶面试的情景。从北京外国语大学硕士毕业的她，如今在吴江一家半导体上市公司工作。去年毕业季，她手握三座城市的3份offer，最终选择了苏州，不仅因为离家近，更因为苏州在先进制造与新兴产业领域的突出优势。“苏州的半导体产业是肉眼可见的‘上升曲线’——政府在产业链布局上体现了长远的战略眼光，我所在的企业周边半导体产业集聚，这种‘热带雨林’的产业生态，让我确信会拥有更开阔的职业前景。”
在今年2月公布的2024年苏州市“独角兽”培育企业中，吴江区共有17家企业入选，集中展现了吴江在第三代半导体、新能源、人工智能等战略性新兴领域的创新实力。吴姝芃告诉记者，这里的年轻人聚在一起讨论的，是哪家企业又突破了技术壁垒，哪个项目拿到了国家级专精特新认定——这种与产业共成长的参与感，让她感到满足，“这是一种与城市产业脉搏同频共振的体验”。
同样，位于宿迁市宿豫区的宿迁电子商务产业园区，成立10年来累计落户京东、惠普等知名企业38家，吸纳各类就业人数达4.5万人，平均年龄23.5岁。宿迁电子商务产业园区团工委书记李含子说，园区有这么大的青年“流量”，是因为有适配年轻人发展需要的新兴产业——“直播(跨境)电商、数据服务、数字金融”三大新地标产业，成为集聚人才的强磁场。
【报告数据】 江苏城区优质企业集中度前15名中，南京和苏锡常占据14席；县域中，昆山、江阴、张家港位列前三。智联招聘数据显示，江苏城市整体毕业生留存率达36.68%，高于长三角平均水平，其中苏州以60.40%的留存率拔得头筹，南京、无锡、常州紧随其后，构成江苏青年就业“第一方阵”。无论是高新技术企业还是规模相对较小的科技型中小企业，苏州、南京、无锡都是科创型企业集聚度最高的3个城市——高质量的科教资源、扎实的产业土壤与健全的生态服务，是它们吸引年轻人择业的重要加分项。其中，集成电路、人工智能等新兴产业集群成为吸睛亮点，仅苏州就集聚全国6.53%的集成电路企业，形成“一条产业链带动一群年轻人”的虹吸效应。
【专家解码】 江苏省青年发展研究中心专家指出，高质量科教资源、扎实产业土壤、健全生态服务，构成了江苏城市吸引青年的“黄金三角”。从产业集聚视角解析江苏青年留存现象，可发现其背后蕴含着“产业能级—人才吸附—生态反哺”的深层逻辑。在产业链完备的生态中，个体随企业技术突破、产能扩张获得快速晋升，这种“与产业共成长”的机会，对追求职业价值的青年形成核心吸引力。
而产业集聚的本质是构建“要素共享网络”。江苏县域与城区优质企业集中度的“南北均衡”，形成“头部引领—配套协同”的产业共同体。这种“产业聚人、人兴产业”的良性循环，为全国青年发展型城市建设提供了关键启示：唯有将人才政策深度融入产业升级战略，让青年成为产业变革的“参与者”而非“旁观者”，才能真正实现城市与青年的“双向奔赴”。
创业“托举”：让团队有底气向“无人区”探索
不久前，中国环境保护产业协会组织评审的2024年度环境技术进步奖获奖名单揭晓。由江苏中创清源科技有限公司等单位共同完成的“烟气多污染物深度治理耦合高效碳捕集技术研发与工程示范”项目获一等奖。“没想到自己创业画下的第一笔，竟被政府的‘政策画笔’延展成一片产业蓝海。”该公司创始人李兵感慨万分。
2017年，李兵结束清华大学博士后研究工作后来到盐城环保科技城，创办了江苏中创清源科技有限公司。创业之初，李兵面临资金短缺困扰，亭湖区及时给予300万元人才项目支持，随后又在场地、人员、配套、机制等方面给予全面保障，助力企业迅速构建起“减污降碳”产品体系，并得以顺利开发出系列核心功能材料与成套工艺，而今业务范围覆盖全国20多个省、自治区、直辖市。
“选择盐城，不仅因为这里是环保产业的政策高地，还因为我们看到当地政府构建的‘全生命周期’创业生态——从落地时的资金支持，到成长期的产业链配套，再到成熟期的市场拓展，每个环节都能感受到‘制度性托举’，这让团队有底气向‘无人区’探索。”李兵说。
【报告数据】 2023年，江苏启动重点群体创业推进行动，目标到2025年每年支持20万人创业，留学回国人员、事业单位科研人员、返乡入乡人员等群体成为重点扶持对象。苏州以2717家初创企业、12.9万青年职业技能获证人次领跑全省，“龙城英才计划”把常州打造成了创新载体万人拥有量0.19的创业高地，而盐城、连云港推出人才落户优惠和创业贷款扶持，形成江苏“苏南引领、全域开花”的创业生态。
【专家解码】 “青年是创新创业的主力军，也是社会变革的受益者。”江苏省青年发展研究中心专家指出，政策“组合拳”之下，青年创业不再是“单打独斗”，而是融入城市创新网络的“系统工程”。从苏州的创新生态乘数效应到盐城的“人才项目+产业链”模式，江苏正构建起“政策扶持—载体支撑—服务保障”的全链条创业生态，专利保护、资质对接等“软服务”，降低试错成本、激发创造活力的“软环境”，都为青年创业者打造出一片“心理安全区”，“人才驱动创新、创新反哺城市”的良性循环成为现实。
安居安心：生活压力一下子就减轻了
“刚到企业就拿到10万元购房资助，生活压力一下子就减轻了。”连云港正大天晴药业药剂研究员刘东旭说。刘东旭的经历，是江苏青年安居工程的一个缩影。
在灌南李集镇团委书记宋梦森的办公桌上，摆着一摞厚厚的人才补贴申请表。截至2024年底，连云港已累计发放购房券1.3亿元、生活补贴2.47亿元，刘东旭这样的“新港城人”成为购房主力。
今年年初，小米软件科技公司华东总部的王鹏翔与其他33名技术骨干从北京等地调入南京开始新工作。如何快速安顿？共青团南京市委伸出援手，协调南京青年驿站为34名小米员工提供了“拎包入住”的免费过渡住宿。在这里，重大项目和重点企业可优先享受“集体入住驿站”服务。
【报告数据】 连云港连云区以房价收入比6.06成为“安居可及性最强”市辖区，扬中、句容等县域城市房价收入比低于7，苏北、苏中地区占据安居性价比榜单前15名中的10席，形成“低房价+高补贴”的安居优势。
南京、苏州等地则通过“苏青驿站”提供过渡性住宿，南京市“苏青驿站”服务人次达15618人，苏州市达7757人。
【专家解码】 安居如何成为城市发展的“稳定器”？政策的“精准滴灌”不仅体现在真金白银上，更在于细节设计。江苏省青年发展研究中心专家指出，江苏各地的实践因地制宜、因城施策，有效降低了青年的安居成本：一方面通过保障性住房、购房补贴降低居住成本，如连云港累计发放1.3亿元购房券；另一方面借助交通网络优化平衡城市空间布局，南京、苏州的“跨城通勤”成为新选择，镇江“15分钟生活圈”让青年在产业园区与山水园林间自由切换。而“苏青驿站”不仅提供住宿，更成为青年了解城市的“第一扇窗”，江苏正用“安居”为青年扎根铺垫基石。
身份认同：“被城市看见”比拿到offer更心动
每当夜幕降临，常州青果巷的灯光次第亮起，汉服爱好者穿行在古巷与现代商圈之间，构成一幅“古今同频”的消费图景。
在常州青年插画师予梦的手机相册里，存满了常州“15分钟青春生活圈”的生活碎片：上班路上在网红咖啡馆买一杯“东坡拿铁”，闲暇时去常州博物馆看汉代文物展，傍晚骑车穿过运河畔的市集，盖上当日“青年友好场景”打卡章……“刚来常州时，我以为‘15分钟生活圈’只是个概念。”予梦点开地图，12个青年发展型街区如地铁线串起的珍珠：江南环球港的潮玩集市、文化广场的露天Livehouse、青果巷的非遗手作工坊，每个场景都精准击中年轻人的“文化胃”。如今，予梦也参与到青年发展型街区的建设中，在万象城风巷·青年里，在共青团常州市委的帮助下落地了个人插画展“苹果之星”。
“这种‘被城市看见’的感觉，比拿到offer更让我心动——我们是城市文化共建者。”予梦笑着说，未来，她会以青年艺创社群主理人的身份与常州12个青年发展型街区合作，开展青年喜爱的交友联谊、citywalk、青春音乐会等社群活动，吸引更多志同道合的青年参与进来。
【报告数据】 南京德基广场2024年第三季度引入63家首店，无锡人均咖啡馆数量全国第三，苏州姑苏区分级开发平江路文旅地标，形成“首店经济+夜间经济+文旅IP”的消费矩阵。苏南地区占据消费活力前15名中的10席，展现“时尚先锋”的引领力。
今年“五一”假期，作为长三角地区最具影响力的户外音乐节之一，太湖湾音乐节单日最高观众流量突破3.7万人次。作为江苏消费年轻态的缩影，常州演出场次排名全省第四，成为年轻人的“爱乐之都”。“端午”期间，首届“苏超”6个主场城市银联渠道异地文旅消费金额同比增长12.94%。
【专家解码】 文化消费如何成为青年的“情感锚点”？江苏省青年发展研究中心专家得出的答案是：青年渴望在消费中获得身份认同，在体验中实现社交连接，在参与中找到价值归属。当文化消费超越简单的“吃喝玩乐”，成为青年的“城市留声机”，成为青年定义自我、连接城市的“情感媒介”，就能产生持久的吸引力。
南京的Livehouse、无锡的咖啡谷、常州的音乐节，这些“年轻人聚集的地方”正成为城市活力的风向标。江苏正通过“消费年轻化”重塑城市魅力，让青年不仅是“建设者”，更是“生活家”。当各地把运河文化、工业遗产、现代商业转化为可触摸、可互动的消费场景，就像为青年递上一把“城市钥匙”——打开这扇门，里面不仅有眼前的烟火气，更有与城市共同成长的可能性。
短评 >>>
把握“人城产”融合辩证法
从就业到创业，从安居到消费，江苏的实践揭示一个核心逻辑：城市对青年的吸引力，从来不是单一要素的比拼，而是政策、产业、文化、生态的系统集成。青年发展型城市的建设，关键在于把握“人城产”融合的辩证法。
产业是“硬支撑”，没有高质量就业岗位，青年“来了也留不下”；政策是“软环境”，没有贴心的安居、创业服务，青年“留下难安心”；场景是“黏合剂”，没有丰富的文化消费体验，青年“安了心也缺活力”。青年的选择表明，做好青年“引育留用”工作，实现“人城产”的良性互动，让青年在城市找到事业支点、生活归属、情感认同，就能真正实现“城市对青年更友好，青年在城市更有为”。
当城市把青年放在发展的C位，青年自然会把城市作为人生的主场。
记者 杨频萍 程晓琳
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->business strategy and marketing

author: @nbc15_madison
title: JPD asking for help in identifying man involved in alleged battery
text:
JANESVILLE, Wis. (WMTV) - The Janesville Police Department is asking the public for help in identifying an individual involved in an alleged battery incident last week.
A post on JPD’s Facebook page said the incident happened June 7 in the 1900 block of Lafayette Street. Police described the subject as a 30-year-old male with a thin build, standing at 6 feet tall with mid-length hair and a dark colored beard.
JPD said the person was wearing a black hooded sweatshirt, black jeans and red athletic shoes.
At the time of the incident, officials said the individual was carrying a white plastic bag that said “Sport City” on it.
JPD asking for help in identifying man involved in alleged battery (Mussey, Drew | Janesville Police Department) The person left the scene before officers arrived, police said.
Police are asking anyone with information to reach out to the Janesville Police Department at (608) 755-3100 or call Janesville Area Crime Stoppers (608) 756-3636.
Click here to download the WMTV15 News app or our WMTV15 First Alert weather app.

author: @tsnua
title: Удар ВСУ по объекту в Подмосковье - как это повлияет на военную промышленность РФ
text:
ВСУ поразили объект ВПК в Московской области РФ: детали от Генштаба
Ночью 12 июня Московскую область РФ посетил очередной "хлопок".
В ночь на 12 июня ВСУ нанесли поражение по важному объекту военно-промышленного комплекса России. Зафиксированы взрывы на территории технопарка «Резонит» в Зубово Московской области.
Об этом сообщили в Генеральном штабе ВСУ.
По данным Генштаба, это завод серийного производства и монтажа печатных плат и производства электроники. Его продукция широко используется при изготовлении высокотехнологичного вооружения и техники.
Результаты огневого поражения уточняются.
«Силы обороны продолжают принимать все меры, чтобы взорвать военно-экономический потенциал российских оккупантов и заставить РФ прекратить вооруженную агрессию против Украины», — подчеркнули в ведомстве.
Напомним, после операции «Паутина» Россия спешно перебросила часть своего бомбардировочного флота на отдаленные авиабазы. В частности, речь идет о самолетах Ту-160, Ту-95МС и Ту-22М3, базировавшихся в Иркутской и Мурманской областях. Теперь российское командование переместило их на другие объекты — в частности, на Камчатку, Чукотку и Татарстан.
Зафиксировано перебазирование на авиабазы Елизово (Камчатка), Анадырь (Чукотка) и Борисоглебское (Казань), сообщают аналитики.
Этот шаг свидетельствует о реальных опасениях новых ударов ВСУ по тыловым целям РФ и серьезным нарушениям в системе ПВО враг.

author: PR
title: Tobacco harm reduction is a need of the hour to save lives in Pakistan
text: KARACHI - The Initiative on Risk-reduction & Dependable Alternatives (IRADA) recently hosted its fourth roundtable discussion in Karachi, reinforcing its mission to advance Tobacco Harm Reduction (THR) as an essential public health strategy in Pakistan. The event gathered a diverse mix of public health officials, medical professionals, non-governmental organization (NGO) representatives, media, and members of the local community, all of whom are pivotal in fostering public understanding and supporting policies around harm reduction. The primary goal of the session was to enhance awareness of THR among these stakeholders, promoting science-backed strategies for reducing the health impacts of smoking by supporting smokers in switching to less risky alternatives. Dr. Muhammad Rizwan Junaid, a well-known researcher and policy advisor in tobacco harm reduction, led a detailed discussion on THR’s potential to significantly reduce tobacco-related diseases and mortality in Pakistan. Dr. Junaid emphasized that adopting THR as a public health strategy could offer smokers less harmful options, effectively lowering the health burden associated with traditional tobacco smoking. He cited the success story of Sweden, where THR initiatives have driven smoking rates to some of the lowest levels in Europe. Sweden’s use of nicotine pouches and snus, products associated with fewer health risks compared to cigarettes, has been instrumental in this achievement. Reflecting on Sweden’s journey toward becoming a smoke-free country, Dr Junaid remarked, “The number of lives that could be saved through expanding access to THR is substantial and likely exceeds almost any other single health intervention governments can implement.” He highlighted the promising statistics indicating that if THR were to be adopted more broadly, not only in Pakistan but also in countries like Bangladesh, Kazakhstan, and South Africa, nearly 2.6 million lives could be saved collectively. This striking data underscores the potential of harm reduction measures to transform public health outcomes in low- and middle-income countries where tobacco use remains high. Throughout the discussion, participants expressed a sense of urgency for Pakistan to adopt comprehensive THR strategies. In contrast to conventional smoking cessation efforts, THR provides a science-based approach that reduces the risks of smoking through less risky alternatives. By prioritizing THR, Pakistan could align itself with global public health efforts to reduce smoking rates and achieve a future with fewer smoking-related deaths and diseases. The roundtable also called for concrete actions by the government to support THR. Key recommendations included developing a regulatory framework that encourages regulation to be proportionate to the risk they pose to health. Furthermore, they emphasized the importance of public health campaigns to educate citizens on the health risks of smoking and the benefits of harm reduction. Embracing THR could offer Pakistan a realistic path to reducing the country’s high smoking rates and achieving long-term public health goals. The benefits of THR, as outlined by experts at the roundtable, suggest that Pakistan’s health policymakers have a valuable opportunity to rethink their approach to tobacco control. By taking bold steps to integrate THR into the national health agenda, Pakistan could pave the way toward a smoke-free future and protect millions of lives from the preventable harms of smoking.
